snippet: The 78 new schools will have seats for 10,000 students in the fall, in all five boroughs, and span the years from elementary to high school.
abstract: New York Mayor Michael R Bloomberg  is moving to ensure his educational legacy lasts until long after he is gone, or at least to make it difficult for his successor to undo it; says 78 new schools will open in next academic year, even though some of those lining up to fill his seat have displayed a less than zestful embrace of such policies.
lead_paragraph: The 78 new schools will have seats for 10,000 students in the fall, in all five boroughs, and span the years from elementary to high school.

headline.seo: With Legacy on His Mind, Bloomberg Says He’ll Add 78 New Schools
headline.main: With Legacy on His Mind, Mayor Adds More Schools
headline.print_headline: With Legacy On His Mind, Mayor Adds More Schools
